item.name: Ceph PG active
item.description: Ceph will process requests to the placement group.

item.name: Ceph PG backfill
item.description: Ceph is scanning and synchronizing the entire contents of a placement group instead of inferring what contents need to be synchronized from the logs of recent operations. Backfill is a special case of recovery.

item.name: Ceph PG clean
item.description: Ceph replicated all objects in the placement group the correct number of times.

item.name: Ceph PG creating
item.description: Ceph is still creating the placement group.

item.name: Ceph PG degraded
item.description: Ceph has not replicated some objects in the placement group the correct number of times yet.

item.name: Ceph PG degraded %
item.description: Ceph has not replicated some objects in the placement group the correct number of times yet.

item.name: Ceph PG down
item.description: A replica with necessary data is down, so the placement group is offline.

item.name: Ceph Cluster health
item.description: HEALTH_OK: 1 HEALTH_WARN: 2 HEALTH_ERR: 3 other status 255

item.name: Ceph PG incomplete
item.description: Ceph detects that a placement group is missing a necessary period of history from its log. If you see this state, report a bug, and try to start any failed OSDs that may contain the needed information.

item.name: Ceph PG inconsistent
item.description: Ceph detects inconsistencies in the one or more replicas of an object in the placement group (e.g. objects are the wrong size, objects are missing from one replica after recovery finished, etc.).

item.name: Ceph PG peering
item.description: The placement group is undergoing the peering process

item.name: Ceph PG total
item.description: Ceph total placement group number.

item.name: Ceph PG recovering
item.description: Ceph is migrating/synchronizing objects and their replicas.

item.name: Ceph PG remapped
item.description: The placement group is temporarily mapped to a different set of OSDs from what CRUSH specified.

item.name: Ceph PG repair
item.description: Ceph is checking the placement group and repairing any inconsistencies it finds (if possible).

item.name: Ceph PG replay
item.description: The placement group is waiting for clients to replay operations after an OSD crashed.

item.name: Ceph PG scrubbing
item.description: Ceph is checking the placement group for inconsistencies.

item.name: Ceph PG splitting
item.description: Ceph is splitting the placment group into multiple placement groups. (functional?)

item.name: Ceph PG stale
item.description: The placement group is in an unknown state - the monitors have not received an update for it since the placement group mapping changed.

item.name: Ceph PG wait-backfill
item.description: The placement group is waiting in line to start backfill.

item.name: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: Host name
item.description: System host name.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

item.description: bucket.
maintained as minisockets,time-waitsyn-recv.
TCP
listen and closed
TCP
TCP
TCP
TCP
syn-sent
TCP

trigger.name: Ceph cluster has degraded PGs
trigger.description: Ceph has not replicated some objects in the placement group the correct number of times yet.

trigger.name: Ceph cluster has down PGs
trigger.description: At least a replica with necessary data is down, so the placement group is offline.

trigger.name: Configured max number of opened files is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Configured max number of processes is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Disk I/O is overloaded on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.

trigger.name: Lack of available memory on server {HOST.NAME}
Lack of free swap space on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: It probably means that the systems requires more physical memory.

trigger.name: Processor load is too high on {HOST.NAME}
